XRcNni6zz3YWKoIYC_hkqw.text: Jumped in here for a quick bite to eat after a long festival day. The rest of the street was closing down, but Gordon's was open and alive. The friendliness and warmth of the staff make up for the tacky decor and extremely cramped space, and the food was just a touch above good.  My wife had the seafood risotto, and I went with a mushroom pizza. Italian food should be simple and fresh, and these dishes at least managed that in principle. It was a bit bland and slapdash for my liking, but given the price and location I really couldn't complain.  Looking for a gourmet dinner? Give it a miss. Want a tasty quick bite, delivered with a smile? Gordon's will do for you.

QXC7Ffpm5zUww5w0Xc710A.text: I'm a vegetarian American in Edinburgh for a conference. Came by this restaurant on a wet Sunday evening looking for a warm meal and felt immediately welcome by all the wait staff and, apparently, Gordon. I had the pizza fungi and it was absolutely delicious!! Well seasoned, well cooked toppings, good cheese and a nice thin crust.   Oh, and free wifi - useful for people dining alone and wanting to browse the web while eating.

KrDsVyWWwYXmQt1RucY7qA.text: Great food and the host and staff made it a wonderful experience. Don't let the look fool you.

Aftror2hLVDQy56u0sT8xg.text: It's interesting to read the variety of opinions about this place.  I've been here once, and I don't remember having a particularly strong opinion on it either way.  Nonetheless, it is worthy of a review.  The restaurant itself is situated on the bustling Royal Mile, which at this time of year (summer) is full of tourists, though mercifully not as busy as when the Festival is on.  It enjoys a prime location on a street that is devoid of many restaurants, instead being full of gift shops for the tourists.  I personally didn't find the food to be too memorable, but then if I want an Italian meal, I will tend to default to Pizza Express.  I do, however, remember enjoying a nice sorbet for dessert, which was very tasty.  My other lasting memory is of someone cheering when a glass was dropped on the floor, but this is something that happens everywhere of course!  It's a small restaurant inside, and it does feel a little dated in the decor.  On the whole, the experience was a good one, but I tend to feel that I would go for a chain restaurant in preference.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon's Trattoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

7Um_vRxSeEau829ZHjAdxQ.text: Lovely atmosphere, really felt transported to the continent, with very personal service. Great, homey food; whatever you take is delicious.

koLG2ckMvmfQYic-YaNzxg.text: So amazing!  My Risotto was brilliant and the desserts we shared after...nothing short of divine.  The best sticky toffee pudding I've ever had the pleasure to enjoy.  Must eat!

2lSP6dFbJ8OYSeSUm6yMkw.text: The restaurant was fine-nothing outstanding, very friendly (owner greets everyone and very attentive staff), noisy and busy, food was good quick and hot if a bit under seasoned. We had the goat cheese focaccia (good cheese but under toasted), the penne with spicy sausage (very good) and the manicotti stuffed with spinach (under seasoned). Two glasses of wine, shared dessert, shared appetizer, two entrees, coffee and after dinner drink 80.

YVyuhKH5DpZjgOcftXbspw.text: It's sitting on the Royal Mile, so it's not going to be Little Italy.  It's a nice enough place, with a warm welcome (from Gordon himself, if you're lucky) and nice enough decor. A bit dated, but hey. The food is questionable....I've eaten here a few times and tried to vary what I have, but it all tastes the same - bland! The Spaghetti Carbonarra is faaar too creamy for my liking (and my hips didn't thank me) and the meat can be chewy. I don't know why  I come back here, I think it's because my Dad likes it - but he likes Ronan Keating, so y'know....

XwTMnkAO8dSrYVpej8_6Yg.text: You can tell you're in tourist trap territory, when the Italian restaurant isn't called "Giuseppe's" or "Roberto's", but "Gordon's". It doesn't exactly stir up thoughts of gondola rides in Venice, espressos in a Milanese street cafe, or hazy meditteranean nights in a country run by a perverted, far-right criminal.  It's nothing like as bad as some of the Royal Mile's more appalling wallet emptiers though, with passable pizza and pasta on offer. Not really much to see here for locals, but it does it's job of parting the unimaginativce from their cash.

-pRPhw3SAdSEs4zGOFaxEw.text: OMG Gordon's Trattoria is our favorite Edinburgh Restaurant. Right on the Royal Mile in the middle of everything. The food is to die for. They always make my daughter her favorite "Angelena Pizza" - it's heart shaped with just sauce & cheese. Look here: bit.ly/GordonsTrat. Eat here. The pastas are the best and you can do a 1/2 portion if it's too much for you, but I recommend you get the whole thing and take some home. It's even better the next day.

xdO6gHgT0RmA5pd7BYhBpw.text: Amazing food and the hospitality cannot be beat. Traveling alone can be tough and the staff here made me feel at home. Plus the owner was there also greeting diners. Love it- try the pizza!

txAalakt1bBkuZQXTNq04g.text: Great food at a great price. We had the veal, the risotto, and pizza and they were all delicious.  The staff is incredibly engaging and friendly and despite the name not seeming traditionally Italian, it was authentic food and a great experience in casual dining.

tttxEp-AnSgOKBOrOyqSmA.text: It was nice to sit outside and eat (and people watch on the Royal Mile), and the owner came out a few times to chat, which was nice. The food was pretty good; I was quite taken by the penne with pesto. The beer selection was pretty awful, though. Food-wise, you could do a lot worse on the Royal Mile, that's for damn sure.

TstoYk_guVXApw7EqdVukQ.text: I went to this restraunt for a birthday dinner and it was fabulous. The service was exquisit, the food was delicious and the prices were absolutely fantastic.   Well done trattorias!

tV92GgbJJWAszPutDynuNg.text: visited on tuesday 29th march - using a groupon voucher - went early doors before heading to see Greg Davies at Royal Festival Hall (far superior to this experience) ... Arrived to a restaurant with just two other tables of people in it (to be fair it was only 5.30pm) but for some reason got stuck right next to another couple despite loads of empty seats - and the next couple half an hour later got put directly next to us...! The starters (minestrone soup) and pizza garlic bread with tomato were ok... nothing flash, but edible at least. The mains however (nothing tricky - a parma ham pizza and a mushroom, ham and pepperoni pizza) were awful - bland, tasteless, undercooked and stodgy - the "ham" was reformed nonsense and the pepperoni full of fat... obviously the guy serving (looked like maybe the owner) spotted the vast leftovers on the plates - and asked "what was wrong" to which I discreetly pointed out the pizzas were undercooked and tasteless - his reaction... a shrug and wandering off to fetch us the bill. Interesting take on customer service.   I'd thoroughly recommend going to any number of other far better eateries in Edinburgh - i'm reviewing at least two others after this that were outstanding - shame some continue to appal whilst those around shine brighter...   And to top it off, the place was filthy.   AVOID.

LXnu05RfobbwWh8ALRfAwA.text: From the warm greeting we received, the delicious food, careful recommendations and incredible service you can do no better than Gordon's. Our server, Samuel and the other staff took wonderful care of us, from caprese to sticky toffee pudding, it was incredible.   Special recommendations:  Caprese Penne Speciali  Tagliatelle al Pesce

u7e7_hn-dPFB2tGy01291w.text: Kicked off the vacation portion of a recent trip to Edinburgh (most of which was work-related) with a dinner at Gordon's - after checking in to the AirBnB I was in for my "on my own" slice of Scotland visiting, and horking myself back into the old city with a buddy for dinner, I was looking at online reservation options, which were pretty slim pickin's by 7:30pm on a Tuesday night. Gordon's had a table, though, so ... off we went.  Gordon's is the kind of place that I learned about in my first city-living experience, in my teens in London (my family lived in the UK when I was in high school), where my very-foodie family made a point of learning all about the restaurant and cooking scene in the city. Neighborhood joints are always happy discoveries, which is knowledge I've carried with me on travels to cities across the globe, from Riyadh (weirdly good Thai scene) to NYC to Paris to San Francisco to Chicago to Nawlins.  Anyway, Gordon's welcomed us, served us some gloriously tasty dinner - I had salmon (photo), my buddy went for the carbo load with a fettucini Alfredo that looked sinfully good - and became another on my list of Great Neighborhood Joints in Cities of the World.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon's Trattoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Grilled salmon. It was superb. I don&#39;t eat pasta, so they gave me a beautiful arugula/rocket salad instead. Stellar.

am68t5v9DS4Y8U65238U7Q.text: Outstanding food and service. This place is family run and the manager does his rounds as much as the wait staff. He clears the tables and greets the customers. I love that he is in trenches and not just watching. He walked around and mingled when he wasn't serving or clearing plates.  We are in Scotland for the Fringe Festival and this place is located right at the entrance. It was prime dinner hour and drinks were flowing, good food all around! I saw a neighboring table order the most delectable charcuterie. Dang, it made me drool.  The lasagna was excellent - it's all about the sauce and the meat. The noodles were an afterthought. Only wished it came with bread so we could have scooped it all up. Extra charge for garlic or bread basket so we just skipped (not thinking, I could've ordered it after our entrees arrived). The margherita pizza was excellent as well, simple and delicious. The sauce! Tangy but not overly salty, very robust and it was not oily as others have stated in their reviews. Only thing, they didn't pre-slice it. They gave us a steak knife to cut it ourselves. I guess that's how it's done here.  Must try: the chicken Milanese. The breaded cutlets (two large pieces!) were still moist on the inside and not burnt or charred on the outside. Soft and tender chicken. I only wished my salad part of the meal came with diced tomatoes as I've had before in other places. And there was no dressing on the salad but it was still good altogether. The roasted potatoes and onions were crispy and charred but oh so yummy. The more burnt, only added to the perfect texture and taste.  Skip on the beef stroganoff, very saucy but the beef strips were very thin cut. I found it dry but the sauce covered a lot of that. Very hearty dish since it came with salad and rice.   The place is on the Royal Mile so I was lucky to score the last table for four! The desserts all looked heavenly and gorgeously plated but we were too full to eat more.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon's Trattoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Ooh, cinnamon and foam on top of the hot chocolate
Photo of Gordon's Trattoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. English Breakfast Tea
Photo of Gordon's Trattoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Beef Stroganoff with rice and salad

QUCPmyrUxFjUyAqnUZjK7Q.text: What attracted us to eat here one lunchtime was the exuberance and enthusiasm being shown by the guy serving outside. Walking up to a table, he was there helping my partner with the chair. Fantastic service. Ordering a beer and a wine while we looked at the menu, they arrived so promptly. We weren't that hungry so asked if it would be a problem if we shared a margherita pizza and could we have a small bowl of chillis as my partner doesn't like them. The answer was 'no problem, leave it with me'. A small bowl of chillis arrived at the table in an incredibly hot sauce. The pizza arrived, surprisingly, halved an on separate plates. Something we didn't expect. Those guys and gals do a brilliant job and, listening, they do it with every guest.  Want a bite to eat then check this place out. It is BRILLIANT. Thank you everyone for an enjoyable lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon's Trattoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. At the entrance

jws711QhE93u6nQZxsub-g.text: The only things this place has going for it is the location, and the friendly service.  The place is diner style booths inside, and some outdoor tables. This is not a relaxed fine dining environment, although the prices might indicate so (circa 16-20 for mains).  The pizzas came swimming in oil, and the pastas were average. The food isn't inedible, but for the prices you expect better.

pPGBYuZeWPDMKVmbdwRDag.text: Popped in here for dinner and was pleasantly surprised by it. Nice atmosphere and friendly staff. Had the special - risotto and haddock- which was delicious. Everyone at the table cleared their plates so I think they liked their food too  The prices all seemed reasonable too, but not a large menu.  I would be happy to go back here again.

36A8Gab0QnWi0Qd-B1xxcw.text: Great personal service.  Was in the restaurant industry for 25 years.  Great amatriciana.  Beef and pork Ragu was good too.  Picked the place because of the 4+ stars, and it was worth it

ieOS8PULt6d9E0SEvUPp4g.text: Great little restaurant on the Royal Mile. Food is very good, nice pastas and excellent sauces. Also has a very nice wine list. Service is great with an extremely friendly owner who comes around to the tables.

QJq9ZTMxXCcBEWNFtFLxFA.text: Headed out from the hotel and saw this unassuming little place and decided to give it a try. We were greeted enthusiastically by Samuel who remained a total delight thru dessert. Chicken marsala and lasagna were great and the real treat was sticky toffee pudding which we didn't know was the national dessert. With that caramel sauce, cashmere could be the base! Great prices and opera on the speakers - do you need more?!?!

0QtmtX7a5mc-LYRRD5uHTg.text: We went to this delightful restaurant on a Monday night at around 7:30. It was pretty busy, but we still got a seat right away. Had a great vibe. They gave us our choice of indoor or outdoor seating. We went inside because it was starting to get a little chilly. Started with a couple of ciders and bruschetta classica. Cider was good; bruschetta was ok. Mains were Penne al Ragu, and Penne Speciali. Those were both very good! While dinner was really good, it was the people that stood out. It felt truly authentic. The people were so nice, and really made you feel like family. As we left, everyone, literally, said good bye and thanked us, like it was truly a pleasure to have us there. The pleasure was ours as well!

BoTcZTDkWtn5n0vtfILobg.text: Great for kids! Friendly, thoughtful, and helpful service - particularly for kids. Their meals came quickly, which we all appreciated. A good spot for the whole family - parents, grandparents too.

znOWfpLCA7VIYz_6Oiki-A.text: We benefitted greatly from the good reviews that took us here for dinner, so I wanted to share that we loved it, a gem on Royal Mile. My husband and I shared bruschetta, salad, lasagna, pizza, and couldn't resist taking a caramel cheesecake back to the hotel for later. Will definitely return here when back in Edinburgh. One of the best Italian food we've ever had in our many travels.

ZtdAaFXzqteyEM4g-GmuHA.text: We had the best meal at Gordon's. The food was fantastic and the discussion with the staff was enjoyable.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon's Trattoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Gordon's Trattoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

5KMw7FPXgQy_QfvEdKwt0w.text: Perfect meal for New Year's Day. I had the Penne Pollo Pesto (that's homemade pesto!!) and my date had a spicy seafood linguine (red sauce, just the right amount of kick).   Everyone was warm and friendly (welcome to Scotland) and location is great - right in the middle of the Royal Mile.   If you're craving Italian, this is your spot.   (Also tried Bella Italia in Old Town. It's good but not as good as Gordon's.)

7E_B6BJV_kTEbG7W447o2w.text: Incredible staff! Great family owned business. Everyone at the table had a fantastic meal. Such a great experience. I wish I lived closer so I could come here more often!! They even made me sangria, which they don't even serve. Which by the way, was fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon's Trattoria - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The calzone is amazing and enough for 2!

sR_rpkbw48GmdHtA65ipcg.text: Great food and amazing atmosphere. We loved sitting outside to eat lunch.  The calzone was so impressive and yummy ! The service was outstanding as well.   Highly recommend this fabulous Italian restaurant to anyone looking for great foods drink and atmosphere

vtBCyLf4pwEKJuyat3bU4g.text: With so many great dining options all around, it's a shame to have to spend an evening here.  I'll admit, I wasn't all that excited about it to begin with.  Perusing the menu didn't help.  I ordered bruschetta, thinking it was a safe choice and that maybe I'd try a friend's dish.  It wasn't so much bruschetta as french bread with tomatoes.  Normally, I like basil, garlic, olive oil, vinegar and FLAVOR on my bruschetta.  A friend had to hunt down our missing waitress, and then I asked for some mozzarella.  I had to do surgery to this thing or starve.  She brings out a plate with a couple of golf ball sized pieces of mozzarella.  Seriously?  Now I'm picking apart mozzarella balls with my hands in order to add it to my bruschetta.  I dab on some vinegar I've found on the table to give it more acid... and it's finally edible.  If I wanted to make my own bruschetta, I could have stayed home... and it would have been much better.

R8KaytNno3fYnfKwvHpdFw.text: If you're ever in Edinburgh, wanting authentic Italian cuisine, this is the place.  The owner, his sweet wife, chefs and staff took the best care of us and the food and hospitality was absolutely amazing.  Rugby culture and all things Florence run True here.  You will not be disappointed.  Best place I've been in all of Edinburgh.

XByI_4IqmF4Lus_R6o-u_w.text: Without doubt, one of the greatest dining experiences I've ever had.  May sound over the top, but until you come here and meet the staff, you won't be able to appreciate that comment.   Let Gary choose your meal. Simply tell him what you're in the mood for and he'll come back with a choice that will completely satisfy you!  A warm atmosphere and an ambiance that might make you forget you're in Edinburgh.   Great prices in a great part of the city. A fantastic choice for lunch and dinner as I've had both experiences there.

-puyNZseIISG_97AUelbqg.text: Visited this restaurant one night and it was pretty quiet.  For a restaurant with prime location on the Royal Mile, I would have expected it to be busier, especially on bank holiday weekend.  There were two other tables occupied and we were invited to sit anywhere we wanted.  It's a odd space arrangement, the kitchen is at the door which provides a narrow eating area along side it or else you venture to the back where there is more space.  The room temperature is a bit crazy here too, it was nice and cosy at the wall, but there was a cool draft down the centre of the space.  So we moved early on to find a cosier table before ordering.   I ordered the ham, spicy pepperoni, onion and mushroom pizza and the my friend, a pasta (forgot what exactly, but in the menu is stated "go on give it a try")!  The pizza arrived and was a good size, but sadly the base was cooked underneath, but the top was still soggy.  Flavour wise, it was good, much better that my companions over salty pasta dish.  I wasn't all that impressed and the interior is basic and dated.  The restaurant is dependant on tourist who don't know better.  Expected more from a restaurant on Royal Mile, there are better Italian restaurants out there... Go a bit further a field and got to La Favorita, in Leith.
